page.title: 13BORDON RIVERS AND MILLS
page.content: Kingsley Mill uses water from the Kingsley Stream which is a tributary of the River Wey. The Wey is a scenic river running through a variety of landscapes including old woodlands and hollow lanes until it reaches the Thames. The River Wey conservation area stretches for 5 miles going through Hammer Vale, Bramshott, Passfield, Standford and Headley Mill. Kingsley Mill ground flour until 1916 and then ground horse fodder. Other mills in the area have been used for making iron and paper. Kingsley Mill has a very large garden which is well kept with lovely flowers and is well worth a visit. Opposite the mill there are sandworks and next to it is a golf course.The area around is used for army training.
